abstracts.cdata!:
The assessment of outcome is
            satisfactory, sustainability highly likely, and
            institutional development impacts are high. It is important
            to note that the accurate project design - aimed at
            supporting second generation reforms, and at building on the
            previous public financial management operation - was
            conducive to the achievement of complex, and far-reaching
            institutional changes, supported by long-term commitments
            and a continuity approach by both the Bank, and Government.
            But regardless of success, lessons also indicate that
            although computerization is necessary to improve revenue
            administration, and public expenditures, it is not
            sufficient; rather, underlying institutional weaknesses
            should be addressed: it is suggested that to achieve lasting
            results, the appropriate institutional development approach
            should be adopted, dealing with issues relating to normative
            framework, human resources, organizational, management, and
            business processes. However, to build support for
            institutional reforms, clear links between system
            improvements, and broader social goals (e.g., transparency,
            accountability, and citizen participation) should be
            established. In addition, in light of the various autonomous
            agencies involved in the project, the Coordination
            Committee, in order to manage operations, and resolve
            technical issues, should have set coordination arrangements.

abstracts.cdata!:
The project comprises five major
            components:  (a) resource mobilization; (b)
            macroprogramming; (c) expenditures management; (d)
            government management control and public policy evaluation;
            and (e) institutional strengthening. Within these five
            components, the project aims at designing an integrated
            information system, preparing norms and regulations that
            would result from both existing legislation and the
            information system to be designed, and installing the system
            and operationalizing it in selected entities at the national level.
